official-title.#text: To authorize the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development to provide assistance to eligible nonprofit organizations to provide specialized housing and supportive services for elderly persons who are the primary caregivers of children that are related to such persons.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Generational Residences and Nurturing Dwellings Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a program to provide assistance to eligible nonprofit organizations to expand the supply of specialized housing for qualified relatives raising a child.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Department of Housing and Urban Development

text.#text: There is established in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the
may require, which in the case of an application for assistance to be provided as described in
shall include such provisions ensuring coordination with a public housing agency that will administer such assistance as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Generational Residences and Nurturing Dwellings Act/s:2/ss:e/p:2

text.#text: To receive assistance under the program under this section, an eligible nonprofit organization shall submit an application to the
Assistance provided under the program under this section shall be need-based and made available on a competitive basis.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may select not more than 5 eligible organizations to receive assistance under the program under this section.

text.#text: For each fiscal year, the
Under the program under this section, assistance shall be made available in the following forms:

Financing for the construction, reconstruction, moderate or substantial rehabilitation, or acquisition of a structure or a portion of a structure to be used as specialized housing in accordance with the program.
To provide tenant-based rental assistance under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for use only by qualified relatives who are raising a child and are eligible for such assistance for rental of a dwelling unit that qualifies as specialized housing.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 8(o) of the United States Housing Act of 1937

text.#text: To provide project rental assistance under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in connection with dwelling units that qualify as specialized housing and are made available for occupancy only by qualified relatives who are raising a child and are eligible for occupancy in such housing; and notwithstanding any other provision of law, any qualified relative who is raising a child who is otherwise eligible for occupancy in such housing may not be excluded from such occupancy because the household includes such child.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 202(b)(2) of the Housing Act of 1959

text.#text: Assistance for ongoing operational expenses of any specialized housing, including costs of supportive services required for such housing.
In this Act:

is not attending school and is not more than 18 years of age; or
is attending school and is not more than 19 years of age.

term.#tail: means a person who is 60 years of age or more.

text.#text: The term
provides specialized housing and social services for qualified relatives who are raising a child; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and is exempt from tax under

text.#text: is described in
The term
Such term includes organizations that provide such services in each of the several States, the District of Columbia, and any commonwealth, territory, or possession of the United States.
an elderly person;
is not a parent of the child by blood or marriage; and
is a relative of the child by blood or marriage.

term.#tail: means, with respect to a child, an individual who is—

text.#text: The term
In the case of a child who was adopted, the term includes an individual who, by blood or marriage, is a relative of the family who adopted the child.

term.#tail: means, with respect to an individual, that the individual—

text.#text: The term
resides with the child; and
is the primary caregiver (or is, together with a spouse or other household member, a primary caregiver) for the child—
because the biological or adoptive parents of the child do not reside with the child or are unable or unwilling to serve as the primary caregiver for the child; and

regardless of whether the individual has a legal relationship to the child (such as guardianship or legal custody) or is caring for the child informally and has no such legal relationship with the child.

term.#tail: means the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.

text.#text: The term
The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall define for purposes of this Act) for low-income families (as such term is defined in

text.#text: is affordable (as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 3(b) of the United States Housing Act of 1937

text.#text: is restricted to occupancy only by low-income families;
is designed to meet the special physical needs of elderly persons;

accommodates the provision of supportive services that are expected to be needed, either initially or over the useful life of the housing, by elderly persons and children that the housing is intended to serve; and
provides a range of such services that are tailored to the needs of elderly persons and children occupying such housing.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#text: $20,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2014 through 2018
